info.title: DRES API
info.description: API for DRES (Distributed Retrieval Evaluation Server), Version 1.0

post.summary: Sets roles for session based on user account and returns a session cookie.

get.summary: Clears all user roles of the current session.
Lists all available users.
Get information about the current user.

post.summary: Creates a new user, if the username is not already taken. Requires ADMIN privileges

400.description: If the username is already taken

get.summary: Gets details of the user with the given id

404.description: If the user could not be found

delete.summary: Deletes the specified user. Requires ADMIN privileges

404.description: If the user could not be found

patch.summary: Updates the specified user, if it exists. Anyone is allowed to update their data, however only ADMINs are allowed to update anyone

get.summary: Get current sessionId
Get details of all current user sessions
Lists all available media collections with basic information about their content.
Shows the content of the specified media collection.

post.summary: Adds a Media Item to the specified Media Collection.

patch.summary: Updates a Media Item to the specified Media Collection.

get.summary: Selects and returns a specific media item.

delete.summary: Selects and returns a specific media item.

get.summary: Selects and returns a random media item from a given media collection.
Lists media items from a given media collection whose name start with the given string.
Lists items from the external media collection whose name start with the given string.
Lists an overview of all available competitions with basic information about their content.
Loads the detailed definition of a specific competition.

delete.summary: Deletes the competition with the given competition ID.

get.summary: Lists the Teams of a specific competition.
Lists the teams with their user details
Lists the Tasks of a specific competition.
Lists an overview of all competition runs visible to the current user
Lists an overview of all competition runs visible to the current user
Returns a specific competition run.
Returns the state of a specific competition run.
Returns the task hint for the current task run (i.e. the one that is currently selected).
Returns the task target for the current task run (i.e. the one that is currently selected).
Returns the information for the current task (i.e. the one that is currently selected).
Returns the submissions for the current task run, if it is either running or has just ended.
Returns the submissions for the current task that are newer than an indicated time, if it is either running or has just ended.
Returns the submissions of a specific task run, regardless of whether it is currently running or has ended.
Returns the score overviews of a specific competition run.
Returns the overviews of all score boards for the current task run, if it is either running or has just ended.
Returns the overviews of all score boards for the specified task run.
Returns a time series for a given run and scoreboard.

parameters.name: scoreboard
parameters.description: Name of the scoreboard to return the time series for.

get.summary: Returns a list of available scoreboard names for the given run.

post.summary: Creates a new competition run from an existing competition
Starts a competition run. This is a method for admins.
Moves to and selects the next task. This is a method for admins.
Moves to and selects the previous task. This is a method for admins.
Moves to and selects the specified task. This is a method for admins.

parameters.name: idx
parameters.description: Index of the task to switch to.

post.summary: Starts the currently active task as a new task run. This is a method for admins.
Aborts the currently running task run. This is a method for admins.
Terminates a competition run. This is a method for admins.
Adjusts the duration of a running task run. This is a method for admins.

get.summary: Lists all registered viewers for a competition run. This is a method for admins.

post.summary: Forces a viewer with the given viewer ID into the READY state. This is a method for admins.

get.summary: Lists all submissions for a given task and run

patch.summary: Lists all submissions for a given task and run

get.summary: Gets the next open Submission to be judged.
Gets the next open Submission to voted on.
Gets the status of all judgement validators.
Gives information about the audit log. Namely size and latest timestamp of known audit logs

403.description: Whenever a non-admin user starts the call

get.summary: Lists all audit logs matching the query

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Timestamp of the earliest audit log to include

parameters.name: upto
parameters.description: Timestamp of the latest audit log to include.

403.description: Whenever a non-admin user starts the call

get.summary: Lists all audit logs matching the query

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results. Default: 500

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page index offset, relative to the limit

403.description: Whenever a non-admin user starts the call

get.summary: Returns the current time on the server.
Lists an overview of all competition runs visible to the current client
Returns an overview of the currently active task for a run
Endpoint to accept submissions

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: Collection identifier. Optional, in which case the default collection for the run will be considered.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: Identifier for the actual media object or media file.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.description: Frame number for media with temporal progression (e.g. video).

parameters.name: shot
parameters.description: Shot number for media with temporal progression (e.g. video).

parameters.name: timecode
parameters.description: Timecode for media with temporal progression (e.g. video).
